content.question: A rod of length <math alttext="2 D sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and mass <math alttext="2 uppercase M sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is at rest on a flat, horizontal surface. One end of the rod is connected to a pivot that the rod will rotate around if acted upon by a net torque. A lump of clay of mass <math alttext="lowercase m sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is launched horizontally toward the center of the rod with velocity <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure. After the clay collides with the rod, the clay sticks to the rod and both objects rotate around the pivot with the common angular velocity <math alttext="omega sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The rotational inertia of the clay-rod system is <math alttext="I sub s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following equations could a student use to solve for the common angular velocity <math alttext="omega sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> immediately after the collision? Justify your selection.

choices.label: <math alttext="lowercase m sub 0, end sub, v sub 0, end sub, D sub 0, equals I sub s, end sub, omega sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the clay hits the rod a distance <math alttext="D sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from the pivot.

<math alttext="2 lowercase m sub 0, end sub, v sub 0, end sub, D sub 0, equals I sub s, end sub, omega sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the length of the rod is <math alttext="2 D sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="2 uppercase M sub 0, end sub, v sub 0, end sub, D sub 0, equals I sub s, end sub, omega sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the rod’s mass is <math alttext="2 uppercase M sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and the clay hits the rod a distance <math alttext="D sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from the pivot.

<math alttext="4 uppercase M sub 0, end sub, v sub 0, end sub, D sub 0, equals I sub s, end sub, omega sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><msub><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the rod’s mass is <math alttext="2 uppercase M sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and its length is <math alttext="2 D sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="lowercase m sub 0, end sub, v sub 0, end sub, D sub 0, equals I sub s, end sub, omega sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the clay hits the rod a distance <math alttext="D sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from the pivot.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
